questionlist.cardback: A key prerequisite for test planning is clear understanding of what must be accomplished for the test project to be deemed successful.
The objective of acceptance testing is to determine throughout the development cycle that all aspects of the development process meet the user's needs.
If your checkup reveals that the work is not being performed according to plan or that results are not as anticipated devise measures for appropirate action
Used to verify that data requirements support the data demands of process requirements represented in data flow diagrams and process specifications
Risk that is deliberately taken on. For example the choice to develop a new product that may not be successful in the marketplace
Interfaces in a system boundary diagram
Additional testable conditions are derived from the expectations and alternative course of the Use Case
A group process that takes large amounts of language data such as a list developed by brainstorming and divides it into categories

The analogy model is a nonalgorithmic costing model that estimates the size, effort, or cost of a project by relating it to another similar completed project. Analogous estimating tkes actual time and/or cost of historical project as a basis for the current project.
